Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for R&R”
Reviews.Author: Gwopilot
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I absolutely love the location! Perfectly situated off the main path, private, but close to everything and right next to Mallory Square. I was on the ground floor (2 bedroom unit) overlooking the pool and waterway (unit 113). I loved the grounds, the weather was impeccable and I had a great and relaxing time. There were three drawbacks but not that major. First, was the cruise ships that docked right in front of my room blocking the view (but they were always gone before sunset). Second, was the exhorbitant price paid for this room ($1980 for 3 nights). Third, for being an upscale Hyatt, I was not impressed with the outdated rooms. I'm not sure but it seems that some rooms may be freshly updated and appointed but not our unit. Don't get me wrong, it was clean but not freshly appointed and current like I experience with Marriott and Hilton. Would I go back? Well...YES...as long as I had a better room and better rates! I also got to enjoy the sunset cruise aboard the wonderful Western Union Schooner. This is not to be missed. Also, if you can do it, don't miss the Adirondak either!

Reviews.Title: “Love this town, better with a 1BR unit”
Reviews.Author: sunhawkins
Reviews.Content: I have written many excellent reviews for Sunset Harbor in past years. This year we dropped the ball and have a studio, rather than our normal 1 bedroom. The 1 bedroom units are wonderful! The studios, not so much. I'm quite certain this room is designed to be a 'kids' bedroom when a 2 bedroom unit is rented. There's really nowhere to sit except on the bed. The room is very dark, definitely no balcony. The TV would be great if I were a 4 year old, but not so great for two adults trying to crane our necks to see; it looks like a 13". The shower has mold growing in the corners. We are in Unit 431A, which is directly beside the road. Trucks unload on this road throughout the night, so bring ear plugs. Front Desk staff were outstanding and tired on many occasions to move us to a 1BR, but they are totally booked for the week. The good news is that we are outside most of the time. Of course, the pool area is wonderful. Restaurants in Key West are outstanding. We love this town. Bottom line: always make sure you get at least a 1 bedroom unit with a balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: Claire R
Reviews.Content: This room was so small you could not open a suitcase. The TV is so small its ridiculous. When we asked to leave the manger was totally unfriendly and refused any assistance. Hyatt has sunk to a new low and will no longe get my business.

Reviews.Title: “great resort-even better location!!”
Reviews.Author: andiz79
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful, with spacious, updated rooms. The rooms are very key west, with light colors, and very comfortable. The location of the resort is the best!! It's exactly where you want to be when you come to Key West!! You can wake up, walk to the dock to see the cruise ships coming in in the morning and get coffee all within minutes of your door!! and it's quiet even though its in the heart of the entertainment!! Love it!!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: melon m
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at Christmas 2011 and I feel disappointed.While the resort looks appealing from the outside it leaves much to be desired once you check in.I booked the room through ebookers and as far as I remember the stay should have included breakfast but the receptionist told me they only served one on mondays which I missed... The rooms arevery small and the bathroom is a bit dated with poor power-shower.(I found hair in the bath on arrival) the free internet in the reception does not seem to be working either. On the plus side -nice pool and very near the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: gt_linz
Reviews.Content: We loved Sunset Harbor. The staff was friendly, the grounds were immaculate with a beautiful pool area, and the location cannot be beat. The rooms are a little dated and the decorating not exactly my taste but it grew on me and it was very clean and comfortable. We loved being next to Mallory Square and all of the restaurants and marinas, had lunch at Sunset Key after a ferry ride (get the lobster rolls!), and also took the sunset cruise from the Hyatt Hotel which included a chef prepared meal. We had a wonderfull time and hope to go again. We own a timeshare and traded in. We do not expect a high level of service so if you are looking for that you may be dissapointed. For us it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place outdoors - a bit dated indoors”
Reviews.Author: KwaiSan
Reviews.Content: The Good --> Awesome pool side atmosphere - they allow your own cocktails at the pool - they have 2 pool parties, one is Margarita day and the other is Rum Punch day. Very easy walking distance to Duval street, Mallory Sunset is just steps away. You can see a different cruise ship every day - they are gone by 5pm usually - nice balcony's. The Not So Good --> Rooms have been updated a little bit but the bathrooms are old. The patio furniture is horrific - it is the resin type furniture and it is unraveling and looking poor. Depending on the room you get is how the furniture will stack up. Several rooms are real dated - serviceable but dated. All in all a great place to stay - would be nice if they just updated the patio furniture and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: TravelLady1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while we were still dating. It was amazing, great location! Its not a top of the line hotel but its clean and you can take your own beer to the pool. We also stayed at the Doubletree which we loved but they charged an arm and a leg for our poolside cocktails! :) We could walk almost anywhere from the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice resort!”
Reviews.Author: foodyfanatic
Reviews.Content: The stay was overall very enjoyable. The rooms there were fantastic and very spacious (had two rooms not just one), comfortable, and clean. The only problem with the room was that the TV in the living room was in a place that was hard to see. The pool was very clean and the people that worked there were very friendly the only problem was all you could do was go in the pool. Sometimes they would have mixers with music and alcohol but other than that there was nothing else to do. Other than that I would recommend the resort for people who like low key environments!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: mmg17
Reviews.Content: I think the reviewers are spot on. The location on this property is a 5. Walking distance to so much and yet tucked away so afternoons at the pool were very relaxed. The pool is actually quite large for Key West and chairs were never an issue. The condition of the physical property is about a 3. The rooms have not been updated for several years. The second bedroom faced an out door wooden walkway that was lighted all night long and contained only a queen bed. So for couples not ideal. But hey its key west, if you are looking for 5 star accomodations, I would be looking elsewhere. One exception we took the 5 minute boat ride over to the Westin Sunset Key and had lunch at Lattitudes restaurant. The food and view were wonderful and the accomodations looked great. Make reservations early if you want to go for sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kbender5810
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of August and it was great! it was a great location! close to all the action. We had walked and drove around and saw the distance to Duval st that the other Hyatt timeshares were and Sunset habor was perfectly located within a 3 min walking distances to all the fun of duval st! The room itself was great to. The bed room were a little small but considering how valuable land is in the keys this was perfect! the pool was great and never crowded. would defintly stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Week”
Reviews.Author: Weddingwoman
Reviews.Content: Just spent another week at this resort and it was just as wonderful as the last time-unit 534/2 bedroom ....Kathy and Rosa were still there from last year and made us feel right at home-there wasn't anything they wouldn't do to make our stay more enjoyable....they usually worked the evening/weekend shift- I think the previous 'rude' comments were in reference to the young girl who worked the day shift..avoid her! The rooms are dated,the beds are very hard and the rugs need replacing but the close proximity to EVERYthing makes up for it-no need for a car rental-you can walk everywhere... the resort is small so it never feels crowded and there are always lounge chairs available at the pool ...You can food shop at Fausto's (walking distance)and they will deliver right to your room- beer,wine,deli,fresh and frozen etc....this is a timeshare resort people so do not expect the bells and whistles of a regular Hyatt hotel- no bell boy,no daily maid service etc....it is designed for you to enjoy the comforts of home while on vacation.Staying here also allows you to use the facilities at the nearby Hyatt hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Place is very dated.”
Reviews.Author: huskerdoc
Reviews.Content: Good location but you don't get what you pay for. Rooms are very dated. I would say 1980's. Not clean stains on rug and sofa. Not much for utensils etc. You are better off paying more to stay in the Hyatt hotel. Very disappointed with this being a Hyatt vacation property. We had just stayed at a Marriott vacation property and the two aren't even comparable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but don't reserve a one bedroom”
Reviews.Author: filftwalton
Reviews.Content: I found a good deal on Expedia for a one bedroom unit. It was awful. The view was out to a hallway and it adjoined another unit; I could hear everything going on. The room was extremely small and barely had room for my lugage. When I checked out I complained about the room and the desk clerk seemed to agree and said they get that a lot. There may be other one bedrooms with all the amenities - I don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PracticingTourist
Reviews.Content: Had a one bedroom unit, all the comforts of home! The veranda was perfect, overlooked the pool and the harbor. We got in a bit early, checked in and they hotel called us when our unit was ready. Concierge was very helpful and friendly gave a lot of great tips, you'll be glad you spoke with her (or him). The day we checked out a cruise ship had come in, the sound of the ships engines quickly became annoying. Hotel is very close to Mallory Square.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful if you reserve at this "Hyatt" location”
Reviews.Author: omcamb
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Sunset Harbor is a Hyatt Vacation Club Resort. The facility has a fine location on the waterfront in Key West Florida. It is very convenient to the popular old town area of Key West. I do not know the relationship between this entity and the Hyatt Hotel chain -- the Club uses the Hyatt logo with â€˜Residence Clubâ€™ written underneath. If you collect Hyatt Gold Passport points you will not get any for staying here. I was very disappointed because there is no comparison between the Hyatt Hotel facilities that I am used to and what I found at this â€�Clubâ€�. When making the reservation I was not presented with the usual Ocean Front, Ocean View and Garden View choices. Given the location and the pictures of the site on their web site you might conclude that that all units are ocean front or at least ocean view. I had two units for seven days at a cost of $6615 (including Florida room tax). Donâ€™t think well appointed Hyatt room, think 1980â€™s decor and furniture. Both units had stained carpets, aging kitchens and worn furniture. Neither unit could see any portion of the ocean. My guess is that over half of the units have no ocean view. Other units have some view (they face south, the ocean is to the west so youâ€™ll need to lean) and some units have (I imagine) spectacular views. Because this is a time share operation thereâ€™s no way to tell if the best units are in the rental pool. I asked for quiet rooms. I received two ground floor units. My unit had a patio next to two walkways -- one went between the pool and the office, the other went to the pool area public bathroom. A steady stream of traffic was present on both walks. My unit was an end unit so the bedroom had a window which looked into an area between two buildings. This area was well lit all night. Since the bedroom window had only an old Venetian blind (no blackout drapes) the bedroom was also well lit at night. I solved this by putting a blanket over the window. The blanket provided darkness but did not help with the noise generated by 5 (!) large air conditioning fans just outside the window. These came on and off all night (June in Florida). The bedroom had a queen sized bed (not what I would expect at a $462/night Hyatt) and a TV that did not work. Our unit had a door that connected to a second unit that was rented to others as a studio. The tile floor under the door was uneven so there was a quarter inch gap under the door. This allowed me to hear every word spoken in the adjoining unit â€“ so much for a â€˜quietâ€™ room. My advice: call and ask for an ocean view room. If they wonâ€™t offer it, donâ€™t go. The bathroom (also very dated) had a Jacuzzi tub that did not work. It also had a toilet plunger (Iâ€™ve never seen that in a real Hyatt) that, fortunately, we did not need. The fact that it was supplied speaks volumes. Parking is offered at $15 per day. The lot is next to the complex but it is owned by the Westin (next door). When the lot fills the entrance is blocked and you canâ€™t get in. They did not offer to refund the parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, outdated cramped room!!”
Reviews.Author: Kj727
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely NOT worth the $$. The only plus to this place is the location. Our stay was HORRIBLE! We stayed at a bed and breakfast(Albury Court) the 2 nights prior to our stay here and we were looking forward to upgrading to the Hyatt for the remainder of our stay...boy were we mistaken! We should have stayed and Albury Court!! The older black lady who worked at the reception desk hated her job and made no effort in disguising that. She acted like every question we had for her was a total inconvenience, honestly in our 2 week long trip to Florida she was the rudest person we came across. If she is so miserable working there she should probably find another job, and it wasn't just that she was having a bad day becuase we encountered her multiple times on different days of our stay and her attitude was the same every time. The rooms were out dated and cramped, they tried to fit two large chairs at the foot of the bed which did nothing but take up any last bit of space that the room had. Two of the outlets didn't work and we could hear the people above us walking around all night. Also, the window seal was filled with dead bugs and dirt, it looked as if they hadn't been cleaned in months...definitely didn't live up to the Hyatt standard.

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice in Key West”
Reviews.Author: marieSuburbanChicago
Reviews.Content: We are not time share owners and chose HSH because it offered a two bedroom unit, eliminating the need for two hotel rooms. Great location near Mallory Square (where the local entertainers/artisans are situated at sunset.) The pool is good size for Key West, but certainly not large. It never seemed too crowded and the people there were older - which is a relief in a town that has its share of rowdy partiers. It was quiet at night. The grounds around the pool are quite lovely and the view of the harbor is stellar. The only cons were in the unit. While the floor plan was nice, the carpeting needs to be replaced as it's quite dirty. The bathrooms and kitchen were showing a bit of wear although they worked fine. I would recommend it for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: labern116
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in mid January. Small studio with no view. Parking was $15 a night but they did not charge us for our inconvience. There were no parking passes when we checked in and we had to wait a half hour for someone to let us out when we checked out. We did not go by the pool. Basically, just slept here. The telephones do not work after 11 pm at night. Could be a problem if you have an emergency. We did the Conch train tour which was cute. Also , did a sunset cruise by Fury which we enjoyed. Go to Pepe's for breakfast. We went both mornings.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Sunset Harbor and Key West”
Reviews.Author: mmcreative
Reviews.Content: Sunset Harbor is the best in Key West. Because I believe this I purchased a week in a two bedroom townhouse with an ocean view. In addition to that week I try to visit KW several more times a year and I always try to get accomodations here. I have stayed at SH many times in a variety of accommodations from two bedroom townhouse to studio. I have also stayed at many other B&B's and hotels in Key West and they were all good but, Sunset Harbor is the best. Sunset harbor has the best location on the island within walking distance to almost everything and it offers much more for your money. Some reviewers seem to be unaware that this is a timeshare which rents vacant units, if you are lucky enough to get one. No, there is not anyone to carry your bags, there are luggage carts and ramps leading to the elevator. No, the studios do not have a view because they are the lock-off bedroom of a two bedroom unit, the one bedroom portion of that unit has a great balcony view and a kitchen, livingroom, dining area and bedroom for slightly more money. No, there is not a restaurant or bar because space is very limited in Old Town and you are within a five minute walk of dozens of excellent choices for both. You could have all of those things if you stay on the other side of the island because space is not so limited there, but you would have to drive and park & pay every time you go out because you are not close to any of the best of Key West. You could stay in a hotel or B&B room which cost more and offers less. Compare the price of a one bedroom unit at Sunset Harbor (bedroom, kitchen, dining area, living room and balcony ) to a hotel room in nearby locations. Since Sunset Harbor is a Hyatt location you also have the amenities located at the nearby Hyatt hotel avaiiable to you including discounts at the restaurants. Key West is the best with history, culture, arts, the ocean and gulf, water sports, funky bars and some of the best restaurants in the states. Budget tip-try the city bus to get to places that are too far to walk. A week pass cost less than one taxi ride and you will see parts of the island that you might never see otherwise. There is a stop at the entrance to Publix which will save you even more money than shopping in Old Town. The bus returns in about 1 hour. I also use it to get to the far end of Duval (it runs on streets parallel to Duval not on it) and then leisurely shop, sightsee and eat my way back to Sunsrt Harbor. I only use taxis when I have luggage or it is late at night. You can track the bus location online before you head out to the bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I own timeshare in Key West...”
Reviews.Author: sjmobley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I own timeshare in Key West. We stay at this place every time. Best location, clean,with great rooms with comfortable environment.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: daskins2
Reviews.Content: Recently spent the weekend at Sunset Harbor. We had trouble from the beginning starting with the clerk checking us into the wrong room. After 3 trips down we straightened out the matter, but lugging around my baggage in the heat is not my idea of a good start. Calls to the front desk were not answered late at night, the manager I spoke to was rude and condescending. Top it off with a mysterious $100 charge after the weekend that was added to my bill, and i'd recommend finding another establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Weddingwoman
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Hyatt Sunset and was pleasantly surprised...The location is 'Perfect' you can walk Everywhere,so a car rental is not necessary-there is the Westin parking garage next door and the Hyatt offers a discounted rate (apprx. $15/day).The front desk staff was AMAZING....We take 2-4 vacations a year and never have I met such wonderful and helpful people.Kathy and Rosa exceeded our expectations and went over and beyond to take care of us.... The resort was very clean and well maintained.The rooms were a little 'dated' and in need of new furniture and carpet...the beds were a little 'hard'...however, the view and location made up for it. Most of the rooms have a partial ocean view--the sunsets were breathtaking! The resort is small so there were always pool chairs available...If you're planning to 'cook', there are grills and dining areas poolside and utensils are avail at the front desk....there is also a grocery store nearby-Fausto's, who will deliver directly to your room at no charge- just make sure you shop by 1pm for same day delivery!- There are multiple Museums and Attractions nearby,if traveling with kids-the City View Trolley was the best 'deal' because it allowed you to get on and off -start early in the morning to maximize the time. Overall it was a Wonderful experience,Great location,Lovely staff and would Definitely recommend it especially for Families!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Sunset Harbor Key West great for all ages, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sanda06
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very comfortable and large with a full kitchen and balcony overlooking a good pool. There is pool side entertainment 2 days a week. The service and Staff are very helpful and always willing to deliver to you what ever is needed. The location is incredible! 2 blocks from Duval and one block from Malory square. We will go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Close but quiet”
Reviews.Author: jas45
Reviews.Content: Very nice place with large rooms. Resort staff were seen every day fixing, painting and cleaning around the complex. Our room was only a couple hundred feet to the Gulf of Mexico. We had unobstructed views of the sunsets over the Gulf, when the cruise ships weren't in port. Only one block to Mallory Square and two to Duval Street BUT at night it was quiet and we were able to slept with the windows open, DURING SPRING BREAK!!!! I would highly recommend this resort for "mature" vacationers

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not trouble-free”
Reviews.Author: landloper
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Sunset Harbor has an ideal location, our room was comfortable and it was quiet at night. The concierge was helpful. The Studio room was relatively economical, well equipped and roomy enough for us. I did encounter some problems though. I arrived after dark and found no one at the door to help with luggage. Not wanting to leave my partner or our luggage outside at night unattended, I lugged our bags up two large steps and through the lobby door. In the light of the next day, I discovered that there was a ramp around the side of the building, out of sight from the entrance. The bathroom is spacious and has a rectangular stall shower. The shower door is at the end farthest from showerhead and valve, so it was necessary to enter the shower to turn on the water. Adding to the problem, the single-knob control is the type that has no flow adjustment and rotates counterclockwise from off to cold to hot. The showerhead is so high on the wall that my 5â€™-3â€� partner could not reach it. When I entered the shower, I tilted the showerhead to direct the spray at the wall to avoid the bone-chilling water that came out at first, until warm water began flow. Then I re-directed the showerhead. Since my partner is not tall enough to do this, I started the shower for her so it was warm when she entered. What does a short guest do without a tall partner? Throw a bath towel over the showerhead, or freeze? After my learning curve ran out, the rest of our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sunsets”
Reviews.Author: RF2009
Reviews.Content: For the second year in a row, my wife and I spent a week at Sunset Harbor in late August. The accomodations - a one bedroom unit overlooking the pool - was excellent and extremely spacious. Although the resort does not have a restaurant, it is just a short walk to Mallory Square and Duval Street where there's lots of restrauants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: tomcarla
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's stay at Sunset Harbor. The one bedroom unit was spacious with the exception of the cooking area. There was a bar with two stools, a kitchen table with seating for four and a large living room with seating for four or five. The unit appeared freshly painted with new bathroom tile and it was clean. The wall decor was fitting for the setting. The bathroom could have used some counter space for toiletries but that was minor. Since there are only 40 (I think) units, the pool was never crowded and had many lounge chairs. There was no bar at the pool but everyone seemed to make their drinks in their room and brought them out to the pool which was cheaper anyway. As others have written, the location was ideal. It was within easy walking distance of historic downtown where many of the museums and harbor were located. We particularly enjoyed the Mel Fisher Museum The trolley car is a good deal as they make 12 stops so you can get to attractions that aren't within walking distance, such as the Butterfly Conservatory, another great attraction. A pass is good for all day and you can get on and off as you please. You can get discounted rates for the trolley and other attractions by going on-line. The Conch train only makes 3 stops so I would recommend the trolley. Since there are many restaurants, shops, and attractions within walking distance we only rented a car when we drove to Miami for a couple of days. Your biggest transporation expense is to and from the airport which is $16 each way. The grocery store Faustino's is within walking distance and it is worthwhile to stock up on food and have them call you a cab to haul you and your food back to the resort. (about 5-6 dollars). Restaurants are pretty pricey in Key West. Sloppy Joe's is a great hangout. Although the cruise ships sometimes block the view of the ocean, they pull out in the afternoon and you will have an unobstructive view of the sunsets. The boardwalk is close by so you can walk along it and see the sunsets. Be sure to go to the Mallory Square Sunset Celebration at least once. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: Thsi was my secocnd trip to this property. This time I got a 1 bedroom with full kitchen and it was many times better than a studio unit. The location as always is fantastic being just off Sunet Harbor and Mallory Square and at the base of Duval Street. The pool is beautiful and overlooks the crusie ships pulling in. There is also a nice hot tub. The only downside is part of the time they had a radio station blaring through the speakers. The room was spacious and nicely funrished with updates such as a granite countertop. Oddly the room was short of electrical outlets. The sofa upholstry was torn which was unexected for a Hyatt. The bathroom is small but functional. It is a good home base to explore all of Key est and you are in walking distance of most everything. The property is very intimate with all the units grouped around the pool. It is tight on the property simply because space in Key West is at such a premium. Parking is in a garage at the Westin next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience. Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: heelgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Sunset April 26-30th in a studio on a guest certificate from an owner. This was our second trip to Key West. Had read the studio was very small but we were pleasantly surprised at the large size of the room! Bedroom/Living area was large as well as the bathroom with jacuzzi tub and shower/toilet area. Desk associates were always very friendly and helpful, especially the event planner, Kim. They even called the room after we checked in to make sure everything was to our liking. On Monday morning they had a poolside breakfast with information on things to do in KW and on Wednesday night they had a Rum party for all the guests. Those were nice surprises. Room was equipped with kitchen utensils and plates/bowls, fridge, coffee maker, toaster, and all amenities you could need. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! This was absolutely the best part about staying here. Hotel is nestled behind other hotels and off the beaten path, but within a block to the excitement. The pool area was beautiful and relaxing and right on the water. Parking was extra, but very convenient. Mallory Square was just around the corner. We also had access to the other Hyatt down the street, which I had heard was better, but we felt the Sunset was much better! Can not wait to return and hopefully stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Awesome setting, Rooms were great”
Reviews.Author: dmanns
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quite tropical setting at Key West where you can watch the sunset from the pool area or your balcony and walk to Duval Street and Mallory Square in 2 minutes, this is the place to be. If you want the view, you have to get a 1 or 2 bedroom. We had a 1 bedroom. The living room and kitchen were spacious and beautifully decorated. Flat screen TV and an IPOD stereo in the living room. Our balcony had a table and 4 comfortable chairs which looked over the pool and we could see the marina and the ocean. The property is clean and quite with a nice sized pool and hot tub. They even have some large outdoor grills if you want to cook some steaks. The resort does not have a restaurant or a bar but not sure why you would need one with the dozens of each of those within a few minute walk of the resort. Its a Hyatt so its clean and well kept but it is a time share so they clean the rooms once per week if that matters to you. Wireless internet access was free. We could always get a lounge chair at the pool and there is plenty of shade or sunshine. The kitchen has everything you need including a dishwasher in case you want to cook some meals. The front desk people were all very nice. When we arrived early, they just stored our luggage and called our cell phone when the room was ready. We wanted to rent some bikes and the concierge called a bike rental business for us and they delivered the bikes to us. If the view is important to you then you need a 3rd floor room. The tropical setting can obscure the view from the lower floors. This is not a top shelf luxury property with spas and room service but you don't pay that price either. You can stay at the Hyatt Key West Resort Hotel about 4 blocks away if you want to spend $300+ per night. You can use their pool, beach and work out facility if you want. In my opinion, Hyatt Sunset Harbor is the best most reasonable Key West sunset view property. We have been going to Key West for 12 years and we love it at Hyatt Sunset Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: jennc
Reviews.Content: This our 4th trip to key west and our 3rd stay at Sunset Habor. We love the property. It may not be the fanciest in the Hyatt property catalog but what a location! The rooms(stayed in 2 diff. rooms) this time like all the others was clean and comfortable. Except for the beds, one was soft and lumpy, the other HARD(felt like we where sleeping on the box spring). They have made some updates, not really noticable. Stayed at the Galleon on previous trip, thier rooms are even more outdated. Service was wonderful. Remember this is a timeshare property, so service is not hotel snuff. But they where friendly and helpful. We arrived early, front desk took our cell # and called us when our room was ready. 3rd day we had to switch rooms, we where allowed to stay in our room until our new room was ready. As a guest you do have access to the Hyatt resort 3blks away. Which has a small gym, small pool and a small beach. There is pool/beach service which is great. We did love sitting at the beach. Also enjoyed the Sunset's pool, which is much larger and usually has pool floaties available. Save the time, trouble and expense of getting a car rental. Fly right into key west and walk. If you stay in old town, your feet are all you need.

Reviews.Title: “Alright stay - stayed in better and nicer in Key West”
Reviews.Author: JennieHernandez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hyatt Sunset Harbor for 4 days concluding the end of our honeymoon week. The stay at this resort was a present from a family member who is a Hyatt vacation club member. The location is fabulous, the jetted tub in the room was nice, and the pool area is nice, but that is the only nice things I have to say. The room was ok, bigger than a typical standard key west hotel room,but nothing spectacular. We stayed in a studio, I don't know how the 1 bedroom/2 bedroom units faired. The vanity area contained the jetted tub, that was nice, but the bathroom/shower area was nothing to be desired. It's almost like we had a handicapped shower - there was no tub, just a curtain - problem is - you shower and water goes EVERYWHERE in the bathroom. Since they don't do daily linen changes - you have to keep asking for new floor mats, towels... it was annoying. The guide book in the room says to please leave your trash at the door and they wil come and collect it every 2 hours - my trash sat outside our door for almost 4 hours. I had to chase down a housekeeper and askher to take it. Parking was decently priced and located next door in the Westin garage. Wireless Internet access was good, and roughly 10/day. We really didn't use the kitchenette, but it came equipped with plates, utensils, etc. I have stayed at Disney vacation club properties and they rock compaired to this. I expected more from the Hyatt - I expected excellence and not sub-par

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: KristininMD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there on our honeymoon, and it was fantastic! We were quiet tired from a whirlwind week leading up to the wedding, and this was such a great place to relax. I loved the bathroom decor - so perfect for being on an island. We got a "studio" so basically a regular hotel room with just one queen bed, and the room wasn't super big, but it was big enough. I know they also offer 1 and 2 bedroom suites too. The pool area was great and the hotel is about 2 blocks from Duval street, where the action is, so very very convenient. Even though its so close, the hotel is really tucked back and is very peaceful. The only downside was the cruise ships that pull into port at 7:00 am and blow their horns. Theres a wakeup call for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: timeforfunKansas
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. Right in the heart of Old towne Key West and Duvall Street and Mallory Square. Just a block from shops, nightlife, the sunset celebrations. The rooms were spacious and had a nice citrus scent to them. Large jacuzzi tub and walk in shower and kitchenette in our studio room. The pool was nice and they had Barbeque grills that the resort will supply the charcoal for. Cruise ships do dock outside but was not bothersome as all. No beach for several blocks. They do have several laundry facilities on-site and the ice machines always have plenty to go around. Roosters were the only noise heard through the night. This is a timeshare resort where the concierge try to talk with you but we were never hardly in our room so they were unable to talk with us. They left notes taped to our door and they left our message button blinking on our phone in the room but we did not fall for this. We found no problems with the concierge as we were out enjoying key west and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, view & pool area”
Reviews.Author: lovebrightsun
Reviews.Content: Used Hyatt Vac Club pts to book this resort for 3 nights-excellent choice! Can see why it's so tough to reserve. Unit 112--2bdrm very spacious/colorful (no 1 bdrm/studio available for our dates for just hubby & me) - would be plenty of room for 4-6 people, although it would've been better to have bathrooms/bdrms more similar in size -- master HUGE--2X the size of other. Liked that both king bdrms were on 2nd floor & unit had balconies on both floors. 1/2 bath on 1st fl would be make this unit work for 6 since couch is fold-out bed. Female at front desk helpful/cheerful; room ready at 4PM (called @11AM from Cheeca Lodge in Islamorada & told rms never avail before 4PM--seems checkout should be noon vs 10AM). 1st floor had open kitchen design w/dining table for 4 ; we liked counter w/bar stools used for laptop (unfortunately their server not great--accessed internet but couldn't access work email--but did later at Hyatt Hotel that same wknd). Nice touch to have coffee, dishwasher detergent, plenty of towels (used them all by 3rd night--just missed Wed cleaning--you can request more). More than ample dishes, glasses, utensils + full-size frig. Bed comfortable & A/C worked fine. As w/all Hyatts--great landscaping around sparking pool w/plenty of chairs for size of resort & at front of property to provide privacy from paved public waterfront area. Unit appeared spotless relative to shower stall, toilets, floor, frig - but could use a 'deep' cleaning of corners of bathrooms/some tile areas. Can't say enough about location--walk to everything: Sloppy Joes, Blue Heaven, A & B Lobster House (best meal but pricey), shopping, 2nd level bar at Westin to watch sunset, etc. Drove down to Bananas for wonderful breakfast & to look at other Hyatt Vac Clubs--other 2 look nice but at least 10 -min drive to Duvall St. $30 for pkg for 3 nites not bad considering location +in/out privileges. Overall, can't wait to go back w/hubby + would be great girls trip. Already tried for almost every wk in Jan-March. Not sure how anyone could complain about this secluded quiet resort w/in 2 blocks of Mallory Sq. Only issue: booked a unit in Bldg 5 which has waterfront balconies w/best views--was put in #1 in back of resort--could still see ocean/cruise ships--but didn't know until checkin.

Reviews.Title: “Once very nice, now not so nice because of management”
Reviews.Author: OldConch
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff not so nice to resort time share owners. Management very nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sf2383
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one night at this hotel. I was extremely impressed with how friendly the ladies who worked at the front desk were. The room was clean and comfortable. The location was very good - just a few minutes away from the shops, restaurants, bars, and museums.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: SHC707
Reviews.Content: We own a Hyatt timeshare in Sedona, Az which is beautiful. We trade one of our weeks each year for Sunset Harbor because we love Key West and this property is centrally located to everything fun in Key West. Don't expect a *****Hyatt resort here. The property is something like 15 years old but is well maintained. They're going to remodel the living rooms in all the units this year. The staff are "on it" and I have no complaints. The manager is tuned into her property and sees that everything is perfect. If you stay at this property you won't need a car as you are within walking distance to everything that is Key West. Staff: Excellent. Went out of their way to make our stay the best it could be. Rooms: need a little upgrading but that's happening. Beds were very comfortable and rooms were QUIET. Pool: no complaints Grounds: Beautiful and well maintained Concierge: knowledgable and made some fine recommendations for dining and entertainment WiFi: not bad. I went a day and a half without service but it was fixed. We will be back here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic spot near Mallory Square”
Reviews.Author: Maine-ah
Reviews.Content: We purchased a low-season two-bedroom at Hyatt Windward Pointe a year ago with the express purpose of exchanging it for a one-bedroom high-season spot at Sunset Harbor. Knowing that it wasn't guaranteed, we were very pleased that the exchange went off without a hitch, and look forward to an annual visit here in April. They're undertaking a major room renovation this spring, so all rooms will look much more spiffy soon. (Fabrics, etc becoming a little threadbare.) Because we stayed an extra night beyond the Sunday-Sunday norm, we were moved from our first floor harbor-front room (511) to a third floor back-corner-of-the-property room (131) for our last night. Much preferred the upper level room, and will be sure to request it next time. The small grounds are beautiful, and very well maintained. Very pleased with the little things like plenty of towels, nice personal products, icemaker, and the supply of sugar packets. Also, very important to me, an extremely quiet, efficient air conditioning system. Very nice to relax for a week +, with a fridge full of supplies (breakfasts and drinks) and coin laundry on site. Disappointments were minor: Queen bed instead of king in one-bedroom units, transportation not provided to/from airport (even though Hyatt has tons of vans running potential buyers around), and while the units are spacious, the kitchen area is very squeezed (but, who ends up doing much cooking, anyway?!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Lollypop
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Sunset Harbor was super. My friend and I went for my Birthday and the location and the accomodations could not have been better. The outdoor pool was fabulous and I liked the fact that there were no children screaming , nor running around the pool. Actually, there were no children there at all. It overlooked the port where the cruise ships come in and again, the location was perfect, walking distance to all the great Restaurants, shops etc. The room had a little refrigerator, coffee machine and microwave and utensils, a toaster and the bathroom was very big and I can't say enough POSITIVE about this resort. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: ksnook
Reviews.Content: We are repeat Customers at the Hyatt Sunset and, as usual, the accommodations were awesome. It's a short walk to Duval Street and no car is necessary. Everyone at the Hyatt was very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place...”
Reviews.Author: cdeb007
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay here and would absolutely go back. It's a great location, right on the water, but a block off the beaten path so you can get away from the craziness of duval street if you want. It is right next to the location where everyone watches the sunset and where cruise ships dock so you get a great view. The rooms are clean. Great bathroom, small little kitchen section and A/C. The pool and jacuzzi are the best part. Very pretty and relaxing. You can see the ocean from the pool. Staff was excellent and the concierge had great suggestions. He made arrangements for us if we needed them and got us a discount for most of our activities. You can also use the facilities at the other hyatt hotel in key west. Very affordable. Would recommend this place definitely.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Sunset Harbor Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 200 Sunset Lane, Key West, FL 33040
